name: PublishOpenApiDocument
description: Publishes OpenAPI document(s) for a service to Git source control.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.label: Service Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Friendly name of the service.

inputs.name: publishSource
inputs.label: OpenAPI Document Source
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Supported sources for acquiring OpenAPI document(s) to publish.

**C# Annotations Generator**
Use this option when OpenAPI documents are generated by [OpenAPI Document Tools build task](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-openapi.OpenApiDocumentTools) and present in the artifacts directory. The release task must be configured to *download artifacts* from your build.

**Git Source Control**
Use this option when fetching an OpenAPI document committed to a Git repository.

**Web Service API**
Use this option when fetching an OpenAPI document from a GET endpoint (e.g. Swashbuckle).

inputs.name: openApiDocumentSearchPath
inputs.label: Document Search Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory path where OpenAPI document(s) should be searched for. Be sure to override this value when multiple services have OpenAPI documents in your artifacts location.

inputs.name: csharpAnnotationsGeneratorOpenApiDocumentFileNamePatterns
inputs.label: Document File Name Pattern(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Names of OpenAPI document and variant metadata files to publish.

**Important**
- We recommend using the default pattern when publishing documents generated by [OpenAPI Document Tools build task](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-openapi.OpenApiDocumentTools).
- Each line should contain exactly one file name pattern.
- File matching patterns may be used. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/file-matching-patterns)
- Files found will be read using UTF-8 encoding.

inputs.name: sourceGitAccount
inputs.label: Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Visual Studio Team Services account where OpenAPI document is stored. For example, **microsoft**.visualstudio.com (only the **prefix** should be specified).

inputs.name: sourceGitProjectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the project containing repository where OpenAPI document is stored.

inputs.name: sourceGitRepositoryName
inputs.label: Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the repository where OpenAPI document is stored.

inputs.name: sourceGitPath
inputs.label: Relative Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Relative path of the OpenAPI document in the repository with respect to the root.

For example
*/documentation/serviceFoo/OpenApiDocument_v3.yaml*

inputs.name: sourceGitEncoding
inputs.label: Encoding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Encoding of the OpenAPI document stored in Git. The content of the document will be read using this value. We support [NodeJS encodings](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#buffer_buffers_and_character_encodings).

inputs.name: useSystemAccessToken
inputs.label: Use system access token?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
When set, this task will use **$(System.AccessToken)** when connecting to Git repository via VSTS REST API. Ensure **Allow scripts to access OAuth token** is selected within the **Agent phase** options. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/scripts/powershell?view=vsts#oauth)

When not set, you will be prompted to add a custom connection for connecting to Git repository via VSTS REST API. You may need a custom connection when the repository is external, or when it has restricted permissions.

inputs.name: sourceGitTeamServicesEndpointId
inputs.label: VSTS Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The connection to use when interfacing with VSTS APIs.

inputs.name: webServiceApiUrl
inputs.label: URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute URL to send GET request to in order to acquire OpenAPI document for publishing.

inputs.name: publishDestination
inputs.label: OpenAPI Document Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Supported destinations for publishing OpenAPI document(s) to.

**Git Source Control**
This option will create a private branch containing your OpenAPI document adds/edits and a corresponding pull request to merge them into a target branch. The task does not push directly into the target branch for two reasons: (1) branch policies may be in place preventing direct pushes, and (2) promotes reviews of changes before they're merged.

The OpenAPI document file names committed are based on the Title within the document's Info object and have an extension reflecting the content's format (JSON or YAML).

inputs.name: destinationGitAccount
inputs.label: Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Visual Studio Team Services account where OpenAPI document is to be published. For example, **microsoft**.visualstudio.com (only the **prefix** should be specified).

inputs.name: destinationGitProjectName
inputs.label: Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the project containing repository where OpenAPI document is to be published.

inputs.name: destinationGitRepositoryName
inputs.label: Repository Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the repository where OpenAPI document is to be published.

inputs.name: destinationGitBranchName
inputs.label: Target Branch Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the branch where OpenAPI document is to be published. For example, *develop* or *master* might be specified here. When no branch is specified, the default branch of the repository will be used.

inputs.name: destinationGitDirectoryPath
inputs.label: Relative Directory Path
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Relative directory path where OpenAPI document is to be published, with respect to the repository root.

For example
*/documentation/serviceFoo*

inputs.name: destinationGitTeamServicesEndpointId
inputs.label: VSTS Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: The connection to use when interfacing with VSTS APIs. An access token with `vso.code_manage` [scope](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/integrate/get-started/authentication/oauth?view=vsts#scopes) is required. This allows the task to create a private branch, push changes, and create a pull request in your repository.

inputs.name: destinationGitIntermediateBranchName
inputs.label: Intermediate Branch Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Optionally specify an intermediate branch to create for staging the OpenAPI document(s), so they can be merged into the *Target Branch*. An existing branch may **not** be used. For example, *someBranch* or *some/path/branch* might be specified here.

When none is specified, a branch will be created at the root of the repository with a randomized name to avoid collision.
